org.hps.analysis.trigger

Class DataTriggerSimDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lcsim.util.Driver
      • org.hps.analysis.trigger.DataTriggerSimDriver

  • public class DataTriggerSimDriver
extends Driver
    Class DataTriggerSimDriver takes in clusters of both class Cluster and SSPCluster and performs a simulation of the hardware trigger on them. The results of this simulation are then stored in a SimTriggerData object which is placed on the data stream to allow for other drivers to access the trigger results.

    DataTriggerSimDriver is intended exclusively as a hardware simulation, and as such, requires that the DAQ configuration is read before it can function. Thusly, DAQConfigDriver must exist upstream of this driver for it to initialize. Additionally, to ensure consistency with data, it is advised that online FADC driver be employed and the GTP clustering driver be set to draw from the DAQ configuration as well.

    DataTriggerSimDriver requires two input collections. The first is the bank collection, which contains the TI and SSP banks. It uses the SSP bank to obtain hardware clusters. It also requires the reconstructed cluster bank to obtain the clusters that are simulated from FADC hits. The driver outputs one collection, the simulated trigger collection, which contains simulated triggers. This collection consists of one SimTriggerData object that can be accessed to obtain all simulated trigger types. This output object is not persisted into LCIO after runtime.
    See Also:
    DAQConfigDriver, EcalOnlineRawConverterDriver, GTPOnlineClusterDriver, SimTriggerData

    • Method Detail

      • startOfData

        public void startOfData()
        Connects the driver to the the ConfigurationManager in order to obtain the correct trigger information. Trigger settings are stored in the TriggerModule objects.
        Overrides:
        startOfData in class Driver

      • process

        public void process(EventHeader event)
        Processes an LCIO event and simulates triggers in the same manner as the hardware for both SSPCluster objects as well as Cluster objects reconstructed from FADC hits. Triggers are then output to the data stream.
        Overrides:
        process in class Driver
        Parameters:
        event - - The EventHeader object representing the current LCIO event.

      • constructTriggers

        private <E> SimTriggerModule<E> constructTriggers(List<E> clusters,
                                                  Class<E> clusterType)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs simulated triggers in the same manner as the hardware. Method can accept either Cluster objects, any object that is a subclass of Cluster, or objects of type SSPCluster.
        Parameters:
        clusters - - A List collection of the cluster objects from which triggers are to be derived.
        clusterType - - The class of the cluster objects from which triggers are to be derived. This can be Cluster, SSPCluster, or a subclass thereof.
        Returns:
        Returns a SimTriggerModule object containing the simulated trigger results.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Occurs if the class of the cluster objects is not of a supported type.

      • setBankCollectionName

        public void setBankCollectionName(String bankCollectionName)
        Sets the name of the LCIO collection containing the TI and SSP banks.
        Parameters:
        bankCollectionName - - The bank collection name.

      • setClusterCollectionName

        public void setClusterCollectionName(String clusterCollectionName)
        Sets the name of the LCIO collection containing the simulated reconstructed clusters.
        Parameters:
        clusterCollectionName - - The cluster collection name.

      • setFilterUnverifiableClusters

        public void setFilterUnverifiableClusters(boolean state)
        Sets whether or not triggers should be formed using all clusters, or only those that where the integration window for the cluster is completely within the bounds of the event window.
        Parameters:
        state - - true means that only clusters where the entire cluster integration window is within the event time window will be used, while false means that all clusters will be used.

      • setTriggerCollectionName

        public void setTriggerCollectionName(String triggerCollection)
        Sets the name of the LCIO collection containing simulated triggers.
        Parameters:
        triggerCollection - - The trigger collection name.

      • getTriggerTime

        private static final double getTriggerTime(Trigger<?> trigger)
        Gets the trigger time of an arbitrary trigger, so long as its source is either a Cluster or SSPCluster object. Method also supports pairs of these objects as a size two array.
        Parameters:
        trigger - - The trigger.
        Returns:
        Returns the trigger time of the trigger as a double.
